member.summary: AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_CROSSPROCESS The audio stream will be a member of a cross-process audio session.

member.name: F:NAudio.CoreAudioApi.AudioClientStreamFlags.Loopback
member.summary: AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_LOOPBACK The audio stream will operate in loopback mode

member.summary: AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_EVENTCALLBACK Processing of the audio buffer by the client will be event driven

member.name: F:NAudio.CoreAudioApi.AudioClientStreamFlags.NoPersist
member.summary: AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_NOPERSIST The volume and mute settings for an audio session will not persist across application restarts

member.name: F:NAudio.CoreAudioApi.AudioClientStreamFlags.RateAdjust
member.summary: AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_RATEADJUST The sample rate of the stream is adjusted to a rate specified by an application.

member.name: F:NAudio.CoreAudioApi.AudioClientStreamFlags.SrcDefaultQuality
member.summary: AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_SRC_DEFAULT_QUALITY When used with AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_AUTOCONVERTPCM, a sample rate converter with better quality than the default conversion but with a higher performance cost is used. This should be used if the audio is ultimately intended to be heard by humans as opposed to other scenarios such as pumping silence or populating a meter.

member.name: F:NAudio.CoreAudioApi.AudioClientStreamFlags.AutoConvertPcm
member.summary: AUDCLNT_STREAMFLAGS_AUTOCONVERTPCM A channel matrixer and a sample rate converter are inserted as necessary to convert between the uncompressed format supplied to IAudioClient::Initialize and the audio engine mix format.

member.summary: PROCESS_LOOPBACK_MODE_INCLUDE_TARGET_PROCESS_TREE Render streams from the specified process and its child processes are included in the activated process loopback stream.

member.name: F:NAudio.CoreAudioApi.ProcessLoopbackMode.ExcludeTargetProcessTree
member.summary: PROCESS_LOOPBACK_MODE_EXCLUDE_TARGET_PROCESS_TREE Render streams from the specified process and its child processes are excluded from the activated process loopback stream.

member.name: F:NAudio.CoreAudioApi.AudioClientActivationType.ProcessLoopback

member.name: F:NAudio.CoreAudioApi.DataFlow.Render
member.summary: Audio rendering stream. Audio data flows from the application to the audio endpoint device, which renders the stream.

member.name: F:NAudio.CoreAudioApi.DataFlow.Capture
member.summary: Audio capture stream. Audio data flows from the audio endpoint device that captures the stream, to the application

member.name: F:NAudio.CoreAudioApi.DataFlow.All
member.summary: Audio rendering or capture stream. Audio data can flow either from the application to the audio endpoint device, or from the audio endpoint device to the application.

member.summary: The GetService method accesses additional services from the audio client object.

member.name: M:NAudio.CoreAudioApi.Interfaces.IAudioClient2.IsOffloadCapable(NAudio.CoreAudioApi.AudioStreamCategory,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: The IsOffloadCapable method retrieves information about whether or not the endpoint on which a stream is created is capable of supporting an offloaded audio stream.
member.param: An enumeration that specifies the category of an audio stream.
A pointer to a Boolean value. TRUE indicates that the endpoint is offload-capable. FALSE indicates that the endpoint is not offload-capable.

member.name: M:NAudio.CoreAudioApi.Interfaces.IAudioClient2.GetBufferSizeLimits(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean,System.Int64@,System.Int64@)
member.summary: The GetBufferSizeLimits method returns the buffer size limits of the hardware audio engine in 100-nanosecond units.
member.param: A pointer to the target format that is being queried for the buffer size limit.
Boolean value to indicate whether or not the stream can be event-driven.

Returns a pointer to the minimum buffer size (in 100-nanosecond units) that is required for the underlying hardware audio engine to operate at the format specified in the pFormat parameter, without frequent audio glitching.
Returns a pointer to the maximum buffer size (in 100-nanosecond units) that the underlying hardware audio engine can support for the format specified in the pFormat parameter.

member.summary: Specifies the preferred legacy format structure to use when converting an audio media type.

member.summary: Specifies for a media type whether the media data is compressed.

member.name: F:NAudio.MediaFoundation.MediaFoundationAttributes.MF_MT_AVG_BITRATE
member.summary: Approximate data rate of the video stream, in bits per second, for a video media type.

member.name: F:NAudio.MediaFoundation.MediaFoundationAttributes.MF_MT_AAC_PAYLOAD_TYPE
member.summary: Specifies the payload type of an Advanced Audio Coding (AAC) stream. 0 - The stream contains raw_data_block elements only 1 - Audio Data Transport Stream (ADTS). The stream contains an adts_sequence, as defined by MPEG-2. 2 - Audio Data Interchange Format (ADIF). The stream contains an adif_sequence, as defined by MPEG-2. 3 - The stream contains an MPEG-4 audio transport stream with a synchronization layer (LOAS) and a multiplex layer (LATM).

member.name: F:NAudio.MediaFoundation.MediaFoundationAttributes.MF_MT_AAC_AUDIO_PROFILE_LEVEL_INDICATION
member.summary: Specifies the audio profile and level of an Advanced Audio Coding (AAC) stream, as defined by ISO/IEC 14496-3.

member.name: T:NAudio.MediaFoundation.MediaFoundationErrors
member.remarks: RANGES 14000 - 14999 = General Media Foundation errors 15000 - 15999 = ASF parsing errors 16000 - 16999 = Media Source errors 17000 - 17999 = MEDIAFOUNDATION Network Error Events 18000 - 18999 = MEDIAFOUNDATION WMContainer Error Events 19000 - 19999 = MEDIAFOUNDATION Media Sink Error Events 20000 - 20999 = Renderer errors 21000 - 21999 = Topology Errors 25000 - 25999 = Timeline Errors 26000 - 26999 = Unused 28000 - 28999 = Transform errors 29000 - 29999 = Content Protection errors 40000 - 40999 = Clock errors 41000 - 41999 = MF Quality Management Errors 42000 - 42999 = MF Transcode API Errors

member.summary: The size of the structure, in bytes.

member.summary: Contains flags for registering and enumeration Media Foundation transforms (MFTs).

member.name: F:NAudio.MediaFoundation._MFT_ENUM_FLAG.MFT_ENUM_FLAG_SYNCMFT
member.summary: The MFT performs synchronous data processing in software.

member.name: F:NAudio.MediaFoundation._MFT_ENUM_FLAG.MFT_ENUM_FLAG_ASYNCMFT
member.summary: The MFT performs asynchronous data processing in software.

member.name: F:NAudio.MediaFoundation._MFT_ENUM_FLAG.MFT_ENUM_FLAG_HARDWARE
member.summary: The MFT performs hardware-based data processing, using either the AVStream driver or a GPU-based proxy MFT.

member.name: F:NAudio.MediaFoundation._MFT_ENUM_FLAG.MFT_ENUM_FLAG_FIELDOFUSE
member.summary: The MFT that must be unlocked by the application before use.

member.name: F:NAudio.MediaFoundation._MFT_ENUM_FLAG.MFT_ENUM_FLAG_LOCALMFT
member.summary: For enumeration, include MFTs that were registered in the caller's process.

member.name: F:NAudio.MediaFoundation._MFT_ENUM_FLAG.MFT_ENUM_FLAG_TRANSCODE_ONLY
member.summary: The MFT is optimized for transcoding rather than playback.

member.name: F:NAudio.MediaFoundation._MFT_ENUM_FLAG.MFT_ENUM_FLAG_SORTANDFILTER
member.summary: For enumeration, sort and filter the results.

member.name: F:NAudio.MediaFoundation._MFT_ENUM_FLAG.MFT_ENUM_FLAG_ALL
member.summary: Bitwise OR of all the flags, excluding MFT_ENUM_FLAG_SORTANDFILTER.
